html: (23) Do good, or do evil.—The challenge reminds us of Elijah’s on Mount Carmel (1 Kings 18:27 ). Can the heathen point to any good or evil fortune which, as having been predicted by this or that deity, might reasonably be thought of as his work? It lies in the nature of the case that every heathen looked to his gods as having sent blessings, or the reverse, but it was only Jehovah who could give the proof supplied by prediction.
